Content: i don't see how distributing the code of your engine could aid your game be more successful.

Author: axod
Content:
The existing IM networks have been bad/lazy about monetization. What meebo etc are doing is pretty cool. They have the audience, and now just have to turn the screws to extract money from them.

Not everyone is after an acquisition, and as far as I remember Meebo has enough money to go a few years while they figure out how best to monetize their massive audience.

Author: hwijaya
Title: Ask HN: Is 400Mhz makes a huge difference in MacBook?
Content:
Hi, i'm looking forward to buy the new MacBook 13". Primarily use it for web development (Rails or PHP) and general tasks (email, music, surfing etc). What I want to ask is, from your experience, is it worth to spend about AUD$450 more for 400 Mhz difference (2.0Ghz compare to 2.4Ghz)?
Thanks! :D

Author: gruseom
Content: One thing you didn't really address is what the benefits of open-sourcing your product would be. Unless I missed something, the discussion so far has only been about the (real or imagined) downside.

Author: sidsavara
Content:
I completely misunderstood, I thought this article was going to be talking about sales from spam emails. Instead, it's about actual spam.

Still a great article, pleasantly surprised. Though as a person living in Hawaii, I haven't noticed an increase in spam habits with my friends: we regularly eat spam in spam musubies, in omelettes and fried rice - I think we are one of the top consumers of spam per capita, if not the top.

Author: Herring
Content: I'm no fan of apple, you can look through my comments & see. I was just assuming on a per unit basis & only for the base OS, i suppose. The extra that's paid for apple computers is a lot larger than the $50 or whatever an OEM adds on for windows.

Author: aneesh
Content:
When you're making predictions based off complex models like he is, transparency gives you more credibility. There's actually a pretty good description here: http://www.fivethirtyeight.com/2008/03/frequently-asked-ques...

Go through that page with a basic statistical package, plus maybe Wikipedia for reference and you can probably see most of what he did.
